ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend French 893 to another student: it's a good entry into the literature and to the criticism around it.
Great works by great authors. Indispensable. Something for everyone. I would recommend it to any of my colleagues.
I would definitely recommend the class: to anyone interested in the period and in the genre - and more broadly, to anyone interested in theory and the way it builds critical notions.
This is a course that looks at literary realism within its wider context, how it emerged within a 'realist' society and culture. I would highly recommend this course to another student.
I would definitely recommend this course. Great course not only for learning about 19th century Realism, but also 19th century cultural history in France.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Essential to deepening my knowledge of the canon.
I feel that this course is invaluable to anyone studying French literature.

I want to focus on French 19th century so the class fitted perfectly in my research. Also it gave memore solid foundations in theory: through "realism" seen as an "critical issue", we have studied many different critical approaches - and major critics - , traced their evolution and know more about the "state of the art" in the field.Great course.
